gw.api.database

Interface QueryRow<T>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public interface QueryRow<T>
extends java.io.Serializable
    A QueryRow represents a row in a database query. QueryRows are returned when specific columns are being retrieved, i.e. not beans.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<T> asList()
      Returns the column for the given position.
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,T> asMap()
      Returns the map of that maps the column name and in the row.
      boolean containsColumn(int index) 
      boolean containsColumn(java.lang.String columnName)
      True if the given column exists in the QueryRow
      T getColumn(int position)
      Returns the column for the given position.
      T getColumn(java.lang.String columnName)
      Returns the column for the given column name.
      int getColumnCount() 
      java.util.Set getColumnNames()
      Returns a Set of all column names in the row.

    • Method Detail

      • asMap

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,T> asMap()
        Returns the map of that maps the column name and in the row.
        Returns:
        the data retrieved.

      • asList

        java.util.List<T> asList()
        Returns the column for the given position.
        Returns:
        the data retrieved.

      • getColumn

        T getColumn(int position)
        Returns the column for the given position.
        Parameters:
        position - the position in the query row of the column to retrieve
        Returns:
        the data retrieved.

      • getColumn

        T getColumn(java.lang.String columnName)
        Returns the column for the given column name. Note that this is case sensitive.
        Parameters:
        columnName - the name of the column to retrieve
        Returns:
        the data retrieved.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the column isn't found in the list

      • containsColumn

        boolean containsColumn(java.lang.String columnName)
        True if the given column exists in the QueryRow
        Parameters:
        columnName - the name of the column

      • getColumnNames

        java.util.Set getColumnNames()
        Returns a Set of all column names in the row.
        Returns:
        an unordered Set of String names.

      • containsColumn

        boolean containsColumn(int index)
        Parameters:
        index - the 0-offset position of the column
        Returns:
        true iff the given column index exists in the QueryRow

      • getColumnCount

        int getColumnCount()
        Returns:
        The number of columns in this QueryRow.
